text: Is there any way to get the email of the deleted contact when the user tries to manually delete it from HubSpot? Actually, I configured the webhook with the event "contact.deletion" but in the payload, I am not getting the contact email.
Hmmm....  I think I would create an app with an endpoint defined (route) that collects this info and then uses the contacts api to perform the necessary work to insert/update the contact.
You could set up a workflow to trigger on deletion and that should let you get it from there.
Thanks, Scott for the information. Do you mean workflow that will trigger before deletion instantly? Is workflow can hit webhook?

I have not tried using a trigger on deletion but workflows enroll contacts who meet the trigger criteria and that should include being able to grab the email and then doing something with it.  You would just have to try it and test a bit.  No need for the webhook.
ok, I will try and see if I can get email into my software on contact deletion on HubSpot manually
